pageContext.analysis: Trump was commenting on two sentencing briefs filed by federal prosecutors in the Michael Cohen case. One of those briefs, filed by federal prosecutors in Manhattan, directly implicates the president in the commission of two crimes: buying the silence of Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal, who were planning to tell their stories of alleged affairs with Trump before the 2016 election. The prosecutors wrote that Cohen, who arranged the payments, "acted in coordination with and at the direction of" Trump.
